nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: availability_mechanism
properties.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made avilable.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: code
properties.description: Unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: complete
properties.description: Description of whether the project submission is complete or still in progress.

properties.name: date_collected
properties.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: investigator_affiliation
properties.description: The investigator's affiliation with respect to a research institution.

properties.name: investigator_name
properties.description: Name of the principal investigator for the project.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: support_id
properties.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: support_source
properties.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

properties.name: acknowledgements
properties.description: A list of acknowledgees in the publication.

properties.name: affiliations
properties.description: A list of publication author affiliations.

properties.name: authors
properties.description: A list of authors on the publication.

properties.name: citation
properties.description: The citation for the publication.

properties.name: contact_info
properties.description: The contact info for the corresponding author of the publication.

properties.name: corresponding_author
properties.description: The corresponding author for the publication.

properties.name: doi
properties.description: The DOI of the publication.

properties.name: publication_id
properties.description: An standard identification code for a publication (PMID, PMCID, etc.).

properties.name: publication_title
properties.description: The title of an association publication.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'publication' table.

properties.name: publication.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'publication' table.

nodes.name: study
nodes.description: A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.

properties.name: associated_study
properties.description: The submitter_id or id for any study with which this study is associated, paired, or matched.

properties.name: data_description
properties.description: A brief, free-text description of the data being provided for this study.

properties.name: longitudinal
properties.description: Indicates whether the study has longitudinal or time-series data

properties.name: study_description
properties.description: A brief, free-text description of the study being performed.

properties.name: study_design
properties.description: Summary of the goals the study is designed to discover. General description of the study's place in relation to a clinical application.

properties.name: study_objective
properties.description: The general objective of the study. What the study hopes to discover or determine through testing.

properties.name: study_setup
properties.description: A high level description of the setup used to achieve the study objectives.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'study' table.

properties.name: study.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'study' table.

nodes.name: subject
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific experiment.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: The age at which the subject was diagnosed with cancer.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis_group
properties.description: The age bin to which the subject belongs.

properties.name: age_at_last_followup
properties.description: The age of the subject at the last followup.

properties.name: analysis_types
properties.description: A list of the types of analyses performed on samples procured from this subject.

properties.name: available_data_types
properties.description: A list of the types of data files corresponding to this subject.

properties.name: cancer_first_relative
properties.description: Does the subject have a first degree relative with a history of cancer?

properties.name: dcc_donor_id
properties.description: The donor ID (DO#) of the subject in the dcc.icgc.org data portal (e.g., "DO222303").

properties.name: diagnosis_icd10
properties.description: The ICD10 code for the subject's diagnosis.

properties.name: disease_status_last_followup
properties.description: The disease status of the subject at the last followup.

properties.name: donor_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode of the donor or study participant.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: ethnicity_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for ethnicity, Ethnicity (free text).

properties.name: experimental_group
properties.description: The group into which this subject has been classified for this study.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: interval_last_followup
properties.description: The number of days between the date of last followup and the date of initial pathologic diagnosis.

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: The primary site of cancer or disease.

properties.name: prior_malignancy
properties.description: Does the subject have a prior history of malignancy?

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: sample_barcodes
properties.description: A list of sample TCGA barcodes (e.g., "TCGA-FF-8046-01A-21-A45K-20")

properties.name: sample_ids
properties.description: A list of sample IDs (SA#) associated with the subject (e.g., SA566098).

properties.name: species
properties.description: Taxonomic species of the subject.

properties.name: specimen_barcodes
properties.description: A list of specimen TCGA barcodes (e.g., "TCGA-FF-8046-01A")

properties.name: specimen_ids
properties.description: A list of specimen IDs (SP#) associated with the subject (e.g., SP127628).

properties.name: tumor_subtype
properties.description: The sub-type of tumor or cancer for the subject's primary_site.

properties.name: tumor_type
properties.description: The type of tumor or cancer for the subject's primary_site.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: Was the subject alive or dead at the time of last followup?

properties.name: study.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'study' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'subject' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'subject' table.

nodes.name: specimen
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products. In the case of contrived samples, it describes any material obtained from a normal donor.

properties.name: anatomic_site
properties.description: The term that best describes the primary anatomic site of the collected sample.

properties.name: anatomic_site_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'anatomic_site', enter the anatomic site here.

properties.name: comments
properties.description: General comments about the sample or sampling procedure.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: The term that best describes the composition of the sample.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was collected.

properties.name: days_to_frozen
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was frozen.

properties.name: days_to_shipped
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was shipped.

properties.name: device_used
properties.description: List device(s) used for procuring the sample.

properties.name: fasting_status
properties.description: Fasting Status at the time of sample collection

properties.name: laterality
properties.description: The side of the organ or body the biospecimen was taken from (e.g., 'Left' if 'anatomic_site' was 'Lung' and it was taken from the left lung)

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: The text term that describes the method used to preserve the biospecimen after collection.

properties.name: procured_or_purchased
properties.description: Was the biospecimen purchased from a vendor or procured from a study participant.

properties.name: procurement_method
properties.description: The term that best describes the method used to extract the sample from the subject.

properties.name: procurement_method_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'procurement_method', specify the method of sample procurement here.

properties.name: specimen_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the sample.

properties.name: specimen_container
properties.description: The type of container used for sample collection.

properties.name: specimen_id
properties.description: In cases where the same biospecimen is used by multiple institutions, a deidenfitied id may be provided here to tie those together. Work with your collaborators assure the same id is used for the sample in all projects.

properties.name: specimen_type
properties.description: The type of specimen with respect to cancer; is it a specimen dervied from normal tissue or a tumor?

properties.name: specimen_volume
properties.description: The initial volume of the sample in milliliters (mL).

properties.name: specimen_weight
properties.description: The initial mass of the sample in milligrams (mg).

properties.name: specimen_year
properties.description: The year the sample was obtained.

properties.name: storage_temperature
properties.description: The sample storage temperature (C)

properties.name: time_point
properties.description: Indicate a simple text term that describes the time-point at which the sample was collected (e.g., "pre-deployment", "post-operation", "baseline", etc.). To add more detailed longitudinal information, use the visit_id property to link to a record in the visit node.

properties.name: tumor_subtype
properties.description: The tumor subtype.

properties.name: tumor_type
properties.description: The tumor type.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'specimen' table.

properties.name: specimen.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'specimen' table.

nodes.description: A portion of the original specimen taken from a subject, donor, or study participant.

properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'anatomic_site', enter the anatomic site here.

properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was collected.

properties.name: days_to_shipped

properties.name: laterality
properties.description: The side of the organ or body the biospecimen was taken from (e.g., 'Left' if 'anatomic_site' was 'Lung' and it was taken from the left lung)

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: The text term that describes the method used to preserve the biospecimen after collection.

properties.name: procured_or_purchased
properties.description: Was the biospecimen purchased from a vendor or procured from a study participant.

properties.name: procurement_method
properties.description: The term that best describes the method used to extract the sample from the subject.

properties.name: procurement_method_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'procurement_method', specify the method of sample procurement here.

properties.name: sample_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the sample.

properties.description: The type of container used for sample collection.

properties.name: sample_id
properties.description: In cases where the same biospecimen is used by multiple institutions, a deidenfitied id may be provided here to tie those together. Work with your collaborators assure the same id is used for the sample in all projects.

properties.description: The type of sample with respect to cancer; is it a specimen dervied from normal tissue or a tumor?

properties.description: The initial volume of the sample in milliliters (mL).

properties.name: specimen_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode of the specimen from which this sample is derived.

properties.name: specimen_id
properties.description: The specimen ID (SP#) of the specimen from which this sample is derived.

properties.name: storage_temperature
properties.description: The sample storage temperature (C)

properties.name: time_point
properties.description: Indicate a simple text term that describes the time-point at which the sample was collected (e.g., "pre-deployment", "post-operation", "baseline", etc.). To add more detailed longitudinal information, use the visit_id property to link to a record in the visit node.

properties.name: tumor_subtype
properties.description: The tumor subtype.

properties.name: tumor_type

properties.name: specimen.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'specimen' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: A portion of a sample from the original specimen collected from a subject.

properties.name: a260_a280_ratio
properties.description: Ratio 260 and 280 nm

properties.name: aliquot_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode of the aliquot (e.g., "TCGA-AX-A1CI-11A-11R-A137-07").

properties.name: aliquot_container
properties.description: The device in which the final aliquot is held.

properties.name: aliquot_volume
properties.description: The initial volume of the aliquot.

properties.name: aliquot_weight
properties.description: The initial weight of the aliquot.

properties.name: analyte_qc_class
properties.description: Term that best describes the analyte's QC Class.

properties.name: analyte_qc_status
properties.description: Analyte QC Status

properties.name: analyte_type
properties.description: Any aspect of an aliquot used in an analysis or assay to characterize the sample. These aspects range from molecules, such as DNA and RNA, that can be extracted from the aliquot to general descriptions of the aliquot's components, such as cell count and morphology (e.g., DNA, RNA, Leukocytes).

properties.name: clinical_or_contrived
properties.description: Is the aliquot clinical or contrived?

properties.name: concentration
properties.description: Concentration of the analyte in the aliquot.

properties.name: concentration_units
properties.description: The units used for the analyte's concentration in the aliquot.

properties.name: contrivance_method
properties.description: The name or general description of the contrivance(s) added to the biological aliquot. Alternatively, if you have provided a contrivance protocol, enter its file_name here.

properties.name: days_to_aliquoting
properties.description: The amount of time, in days, between the date used for index and the time the aliquot was separated from the whole sample.

properties.name: days_to_assay
properties.description: The amount of time, in days, between the date used for index and the assay used to address this analyte.

properties.name: isolation_method
properties.description: The name or general description of the method used to isolate the analyte. Alternatively, if you have provided a protocol, put the file_name here.

properties.name: label_name
properties.description: The name of the label used in preparation of the analyte for analysis (e.g., Biotin).

properties.name: label_protocol
properties.description: The protocol used to label the analyte (please either provide link to protocol/file or describe in free text).

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: storage_temperature
properties.description: The temperature, in centigrade, at which the aliquot was preserved and/or stored.

properties.name: tumor_subtype
properties.description: The tumor subtype.

properties.name: tumor_type
properties.description: The tumor type.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'aliquot' table.

nodes.name: expression_array
nodes.description: Data file containing raw intensity values from an expression array (CEL) or final expression results after array aggregation and normalization.

properties.name: aliquot_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the corresponding aliquot.

properties.name: analysis_software
properties.description: The name and version of the software use to generate the file.

properties.name: analysis_type
properties.description: The type of analysis used to generate the file.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: dcc_file_id
properties.description: The file ID (FI#) of the file in the dcc.icgc.org data exploration portal (e.g., "FI208496").

properties.name: donor_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the corresponding donor or study participant.

properties.name: donor_ids
properties.description: A list of donor_ids (DO#) related to this file from the dcc.icgc.org portal.

properties.name: experimental_strategy
properties.description: A general description of the experimental strategy used to generate the file.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: platform
properties.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: A general description of the experimental strategy used to generate the file.

properties.name: reference_genome_build
properties.description: A general description of the experimental strategy used to generate the file.

properties.name: reference_genome_name
properties.description: A general description of the experimental strategy used to generate the file.

properties.name: reference_genome_url
properties.description: A general description of the experimental strategy used to generate the file.

properties.name: sample_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the corresponding sample.

properties.name: sample_ids
properties.description: A list of sample IDs (SA#) corresponding to this file from the dcc.icgc.org portal.

properties.name: specimen_barcode
properties.description: The TCGA barcode for the corresponding specimen.

properties.name: specimen_ids
properties.description: A list of specimen IDs (SP#) corresponding to this file from the dcc.icgc.org portal.

properties.name: specimen_type
properties.description: A description of the corresponding biospecimen.

properties.name: storage_urls
properties.description: A list of URLs where the file is stored in the cloud.

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version of the expression array file (e.g., version 3 for a CEL file).

properties.name: workflow_end_datetime
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: workflow_link
properties.description: If a specific workflow or pipeline was used to generate the file (aggregation/normalization workflow), provide the name, location or link to the workflow used.

properties.name: workflow_start_datetime
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: workflow_type
properties.description: Generic name for the workflow used to analyze a data set.

properties.name: workflow_version
properties.description: Major version for a workflow.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'aliquot' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'expression_array' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'expression_array' table.

properties.name: expression_array.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'expression_array' table.

nodes.name: read_group
nodes.description: Sequencing reads from one lane of an NGS experiment.

properties.name: RIN
properties.description: A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products.

properties.name: adapter_name
properties.description: Name of the sequencing adapter.

properties.name: adapter_sequence
properties.description: Base sequence of the sequencing adapter.

properties.name: base_caller_name
properties.description: Name of the base caller.

properties.name: base_caller_version
properties.description: Version of the base caller.

properties.name: experiment_name
properties.description: Submitter-defined name for the experiment.

properties.name: flow_cell_barcode
properties.description: Flow Cell Barcode.

properties.name: fragment_maximum_length
properties.description: Maximum length of the sequenced fragments (e.g., as predicted by Agilent Bioanalyzer).

properties.name: fragment_mean_length
properties.description: Mean length of the sequenced fragments (e.g., as predicted by Agilent Bioanalyzer).

properties.name: fragment_minimum_length
properties.description: Minimum length of the sequenced fragments (e.g., as predicted by Agilent Bioanalyzer).

properties.name: fragment_standard_deviation_length
properties.description: Standard deviation of the sequenced fragments length (e.g., as predicted by Agilent Bioanalyzer).

properties.name: includes_spike_ins
properties.description: Spike-in included?

properties.name: instrument_model
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the sample dimension that is greater than the shortest dimension and less than the longest dimension, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: is_paired_end
properties.description: Are the reads paired end?

properties.name: lane_number
properties.description: The basic machine unit for sequencing. For Illumina machines, this reflects the physical lane number. Wrong or missing information may affect analysis results.

properties.name: library_name
properties.description: Name of the library.

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_catalog_number
properties.description: Catalog of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_name
properties.description: Name of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_vendor
properties.description: Vendor of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_preparation_kit_version
properties.description: Version of Library Preparation Kit

properties.name: library_selection
properties.description: Library Selection Method

properties.name: library_strand
properties.description: Library stranded-ness.

properties.name: library_strategy
properties.description: Library strategy.

properties.name: multiplex_barcode
properties.description: The barcode/index sequence used. Wrong or missing information may affect analysis results.

properties.name: platform
properties.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

properties.name: read_group_name
properties.description: Read Group Name

properties.name: read_length
properties.description: Length of the reads

properties.name: sequencing_center
properties.description: Name of the center that provided the sequence files.

properties.name: sequencing_date
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: size_selection_range
properties.description: Range of size selection.

properties.name: spike_ins_concentration
properties.description: Spike in concentration.

properties.name: spike_ins_fasta
properties.description: Name of the FASTA file that contains the spike-in sequences.

properties.name: target_capture_kit
properties.description: Name of Target Capture Kit.

properties.name: to_trim_adapter_sequence
properties.description: Does the user suggest adapter trimming?

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'aliquot' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'read_group' table.

properties.name: read_group.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'read_group' table.
